trackinfo.title: Pillars of the Firmament
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
For the 25th PATHOS catalog release, I have decided to do what was done with Blue Emerald Halftone - issue a session that presently came to pass, in order to keep the Vibra catalog up to date, at least periodically, as many of these sessions are published up to two years after they have taken place.
Pillars of the Firmament is a somewhat new-age session with the Korg Opsix, an altered FM synthesizer, which is to say a six-operator FM synth that is also capable of many other possible configurations, thanks to an extensive internal patching matrix, voluminous libraries of waveforms to use as carriers and modulators, multiple filter profiles (themselves patterned after more famous machines such as the MS-20 and Poly 6) and a deep array of FX processors, from the staple reverbs, delays, pans and filtering to more esoteric things such as granular glitch-effects, amp and speaker emulation, gain circuits and wavefolding.
Here, the Opsix explores a patch I made, centering around Karplus-like voices that are held infinitely by way of tricking the machine's damper input into thinking that its polarity has been inverted, essentially sustaining tone forever. Four layers of this sustained sound have been dubbed together and tuned separate from one another, resulting in a swirling blanket of warmth that definitely doesn't bring to mind the surface idea of digital synthesis, which often comes with a maligned reputation for being cold and harsh. The Opsix is a deep machine, with limitations of its own, of course, but certainly capable of a lot of new sounds that I've not been able to easily achieve outside of software in my studio.
Thematically, the session conjured up images of the heavens, albeit old-world depictions of the heavens found frequently in works of classical art, which usually reflected a more primitive understanding of the cosmos, or an outright religious depiction of it. This felt oddly appropriate considering the Opsix's ability to convey unnatural yet organically shaped sound, almost deceitfully coming out of a digital workflow. It is the divine rendered in plastic and metal, fashioned by longing hands that can only imagine what the stars and spheres really are, so upward they build, deified and profane towers of humanity's hope, reaching out like Adam to grasp the hand of God, but never reaching that destination. The grandeur of futility, and the futility of grandeur.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: Therian Cymbal
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
Therian Cymbal was a single session from October 27th, 2021, recorded as a soundcheck for an upcoming live broadcast from the studio. It is a simple piece, built using only a sample of my late dog Charly whining in our van during the long drive up from South Carolina to Ohio in 2016 as its sole source.
Hilariously, we knew beforehand that he did not travel well in a vehicle, so our vet gave us some sedatives for him to ease his stress on the long trip...and they did absolutely nothing. It was no big surprise that a stoic goodboy such as Charly would power through sedatives in order to continue his sad singing, so I recorded it at the time, half as a joke, and half as a document of just what the chaotic and terrible move was really like, lest I ever forget and somehow decide moving 600 miles is a good idea again. In hindsight, I'm grateful to my past self for recording Charly in that moment, as it is now a way for me to integrate him into my work in the same way I integrate any other things that I love and respect, and I have long felt that as long as someone remembers and thinks about you, you're never really gone.
This exact sample has already appeared in numerous Milieu tracks as the voice of melodic developments, with "Six or Eight" and "Planet Everfree" coming to mind at the moment, and remains one of those special aural artifacts in my sample library that never leave any of my sampler devices. Having lost Charly to cancer just over a year ago, he's been on my mind a bit more than usual, but he's never very far from my thoughts, and having just recently lost our cat, Boris, as well, it occurred to me that this recording existed in my archive, and would be aptly released as, hopefully, a source of comfort for anyone who has lost an animal member of their family.
However, I do not wish for this release to be listened to from a hushed and maudlin perspective - quite the opposite. I would like for the sound generated to become something entirely other, proof positive that a significant amount of art and creative work are simply the results of catharsis, the transfiguration of suffering into sweetness.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: Sangean Sea III
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
Sangean Sea III is a slight misnomer, as this session was generated by a CCrane hurricane radio, tuned to something/somewhere on the FM band, and not the Sangean shortwave radio that initiated this session header. In hindsight, this is a small deviation from the original path, and so with this third iteration of Sangean Sea, the header expands to include any radio-sourced experiments.
This session was a relatively simple setup, relying heavily on extremely slow envelopes modulating a highpass and a bandpass filter, with a chorus-modulated reverb on the aux send, and a single stereo-inverted delay of the pre-reverb signal path. A "nothing and nowhere" location on the FM band was found and then sent into Mutable Instruments Clouds, where it was used as a constant sampling input source for the eight-second buffer, and rearranged probabilistically before being sent back out through a granular reverb. The highpass filter is heard first, slowly opening to allow more and more of the lower frequency spectrum, then when it has completely opened, the bandpass filter is introduced over time, with its initial position locked in the sub-bass range with a bit of resonance applied. Once the dry/wet mix fully transitions to the bandpass, another slow envelope begins to sweep the bandpass filter's central frequency upward, until it too leaves only the high frequency band. At this point, the original envelope that introduced the bandpass filter's saturation is inverted, to slowly re-reveal the original state of the radio band, with no filtering applied at all, and slowly, again the highpass filter is reintroduced, and fully saturates the piece until nothing but static is left to fade out.
The purpose of this session was to explore, very slowly and almost pointillistically, the presence of all possible frequencies simultaneous in noise, albeit noise generated via radio tuner and not a noise generator within a synthesizer. By slowly moving the center of a filter around the frequency spectrum, different tonal and textural characteristics are emphasized at different moments, with the reverberation applied in the auxiliary send allowing all of this change in color to occur in a greater "external" space, simulating the natural reverberation of the outdoors, perhaps a wooded clearing away from buildings. A solitary retreat in the forest, still longing for and dreaming of the vivid sea, while the waves are eventually revealed to be nothing more than an out of tune radio next to a sleeping bag in a dim tent.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: Sun Keep Vigil
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: Sun Keep Vigil was the first session recorded when I returned to the ARP 2600, after taking some time away since 2021. I recently ordered some custom 3d printed white fader caps from a very nice engineer in Germany, to make the ARP's 63 faders a bit easier on the fingers, and somewhat unsurprisingly, the tactile changes have altered what I now do with this machine in subtle ways. Sun Keep Vigil is, at it's heart, a very simple patch, with all three oscillators in the 2600 playing a shelf register sequence in the major pentatonic scale (via Ornament & Crime), that is using the digits of Pi to inform the timing and the octave range of the sequence. From there, the 2600 shapes and colors the sound with modulation from an internal LFO and a mechanical spring reverb tank within the unit itself, and this audio is then routed into a granular processor, which pulls the information apart inside a buffer, and reiterates it probabilistically, with beautiful long reverb tails. The resultant recording is a peaceful one, recalling mental images of an undisturbed stone shrine, on a remote island, that contains a magical stone on an altar, absorbing the sun's rays over thousands of years, waiting for a ship to land outside the temple walls and retrieve it, in some incalculably distant age.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: Shimmering Digital Transients
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: Shimmering Digital Transients was a single exploratory session recorded on July 12th, 2020, only a few months into the global pandemic, with the R-EW Audioholistics system still in a very embryonic state. During this time, extensive experiments were being done with routing anything and everything that produced a sound in the White Pillar Workshop into the system, simply for the act of observing the results. In this case, the Korg ER-1 digital drum synthesizer was chosen for a session, and heavily processing the machine's output within a granular drone setting manifested a wonderful shimmering wall (as Brian Evenson may have put it himself). I have long championed the ER-1 as my personal favorite drum machine, because it does not rely on a bank of samples, but rather, behaves more like an FM synthesizer with a few waveforms of pure sound that are shaped via frequency/amplitude/cross modulation, a high/lowpass filter, a digital delay that resembles the PT2399 and a powerful motion sequencing capability to automate nearly every function. It also includes two dedicated external inputs that can facilitate feedback loops as well as realtime sampling from outer sources, and so it follows that this machine performs quite well alongside a modular system that is designed to process and transfigure sound from any provenance. Eventually, more ER-1/R-EW sessions will likely come to pass, but for now, this singular drone session stands as a testament to the strength of the ER-1 and the otherworldly versatility of the R-EW system, even at that early point in its development.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: Pumula Riverbanks
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
Pumula Riverbanks was a session from the late Summer/early Autumn, exploring the low frequency noise generator within the ARP 2600 as a stimulus for Mutable Instruments Rings' external input. The result is a warm and flowing cloud of Karplus Strong synthesis that doesn't seem to resemble any of the tools or processes used to manifest it. The title was derived generatively using an eclectic anagram generator, although incidentally the word 'pumula' is a Zulu word that means rest and relaxation. This was, as Bob Ross was fond of saying, a happy accident, and it should be mentioned transparently that I have no interest in appropriating African language for my own uses, and that any relation to this beyond the topical title is incidental and wholly unintended.
Generative music frequently presents me with a number of challenges, which are by design very different than those involved in compositional work, and one such challenge is the reality of the process, which provides me with beautiful musical recordings quicker than I have the ability to even name them. This highlights the need for session headers that are reliably reused in the Vibra catalog, but for singular recordings such as this one, a bit more imagination must still be employed.
The irony of having to apply manual effort in order to publish generative music is not lost on me, but I hope that the material, as ever, says more than anything I could ever hope to write or imply. The system is the music, and any derivations from it are just tributaries that run back to its ever-growing wellspring.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: Summering Totemic
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: Summering Totemic was a session recorded in the end of June 2022, using the Arturia Microfreak's Harmonic oscillator engine in conjunction with two low-pass filters, a time-domain pitch shifter and a four-head digital tape delay system, with final processing completed a few months later using Goldwave's Frequency Blend processor. It explores overtones of bell-like surfaces and metallic resonance, through a lens of softened filtering and probabilistic granular synthesis, producing a warm bath of tones that accumulate into a comfortable fog. Influenced in part by Wolfgang Voigt's earlier GAS recordings, as well as a little bit of Oval's 94 Diskont in the chordal profiles, Summering Totemic is a slight recall of warmer weather held back from publication until the coldest season arrives, where it will be more apt for cozy listening and disarming meditative usages.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

trackinfo.title: This Woven Altar
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: This Woven Altar is one of several unexpected new fruits borne from the Frequency Blend algorithm in Goldwave, which has managed to single-handedly transform existing session work into completely new pastures of vibrant sound. This session's source sound originated from the same recording that produced Fabled Key, and should be seen as an alternative dimension of that piece, perhaps illustrating what an Arturia Microfreak may have sounded like in the hands of 2006-2007 era Milieu.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Four], released March 3, 2023

Milieu.title: Divergent Paths [Volume One]
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
Divergent Paths collects ambient and generative recording sessions that were previously issued exclusively to subscribers of the Vibratelepathos series (  vibratelepathos.bandcamp.com  ) in box sets of eight sessions each. These sessions notably exist outside of the 'main' Vibra catalog, usually due to their origins as more unique or esoteric studio processes, sometimes involving the repurposing/reprocessing of outtakes or even damaged recordings that could not be otherwise released. The self-oscillating nature of the R-EW Audioholistics modular system makes many new things possible for audio that would otherwise be discarded, and Divergent Paths capitalizes fully upon this fact by providing a catalog dedicated solely to these peripheries.
Divergent Paths sessions are in no way considered to be lesser, or weirder, or more inaccessible than the Vibra series recordings - in truth, many of my favorite modular recordings to date reside within this series, such as 'Roman Fountains', 'Waterbearer' and 'Mesolith' to name a few. It is for this reason I've decided now to offer these recordings to the general public, after they have enjoyed over two years in the shade of exclusivity, although their pricing here, in these eight-part collections, is more indicative of their runtimes and the box sets themselves.
All Divergent Paths sessions (noted by their PATHOS ## catalog designations) remain available to all new and existing subscribers of the Vibratelepathos series, at any subscription tier, and it is my sincere hope that this material is able to reach as many people as possible, whether it is a digital exclusive in a subscription service or a more formalized physical collection such as this, as the entirety of my Vibra session work is driven by a desire to facilitate healthy and pleasurable escapism through the medium of sound, as an aid to sleeping, meditation, creative work, substance-led and substance-free gnostic states and even more intimate applications.
Volume One of the Divergent Paths series collects the first eight sessions:
PATHOS 1 - Amethyst Extracts
PATHOS 2 - Inverse Grey
PATHOS 3 - Inverse Grey II
PATHOS 4 - Mother of Cosmos
PATHOS 5 - Mother of Cosmos II
PATHOS 6 - White Nothing
PATHOS 7 - Kinematic Initiatives
PATHOS 8 - Roman Fountains
Information about each individual session may be found in the track details section of each piece, for those interested. These notes include contextual details about where and when the pieces were recorded, patch notes and other relevant specifics.
Milieu.credits:
released July 20, 2022
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at White Pillar, 2020, using the R-EW Audioholistics generative system and modular processing path, in conjunction with several other external sound sources, machines and processors. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Milieu Music number PATH001. (C) + (P) Oscillog ASCAP 2022. All nights preserved.
Special thanks to the subscribers at Vibratelepathos, without whom these recordings might not exist at all, and to the members of the Milieu Music Fan Club at Patreon, whose continual support of my work is essential and gracious.

trackinfo.title: Flooded Amethyst Mine
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: AMETHYST EXTRACTS is a set of two tracks that manifested as a result of the many different processing steps that went into producing the twenty-eight hour FLAWLESS AMETHYST release. They bear hardly any resemblance to the fully realized work, illustrating just how convoluted these sessions can become. The two pieces presented here are, essentially, what FLAWLESS AMETHYST was at some point, before the decision was made to continue smearing, regenerating and transfiguring the audio into other shapes. An appropriate first entry in the Divergent Paths series of supplemental broadcast materials.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Flooded Amethyst Mine II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: AMETHYST EXTRACTS is a set of two tracks that manifested as a result of the many different processing steps that went into producing the twenty-eight hour FLAWLESS AMETHYST release. They bear hardly any resemblance to the fully realized work, illustrating just how convoluted these sessions can become. The two pieces presented here are, essentially, what FLAWLESS AMETHYST was at some point, before the decision was made to continue smearing, regenerating and transfiguring the audio into other shapes. An appropriate first entry in the Divergent Paths series of supplemental broadcast materials.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Inverse Grey
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: INVERSE GREY I is the first of two "inversions" of the RED YELLOW BLUE session material - tangential paths explored while en route to completing the main body of work - using reversed and re-pitched tape, underpowered delay FX units and heavy use of low-pass filtering and dbx noise reduction to counteract the large amount of noise generated from the low powerage. The resultant two pieces are interesting perspectives on the original source (mixer feedback) that, at this stage of processing, more resemble processed vocal sounds, perhaps along similar lines as Ligeti's choral works as they appeared in Kubrick's 2001.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Inverse Grey II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: INVERSE GREY II is the second of two "inversions" of the RED YELLOW BLUE session material - tangential paths explored while en route to completing the main body of work - using reversed and re-pitched tape, underpowered delay FX units and heavy use of low-pass filtering and dbx noise reduction to counteract the large amount of noise generated from the low powerage. The resultant two pieces are interesting perspectives on the original source (mixer feedback) that, at this stage of processing, more resemble processed vocal sounds, perhaps along similar lines as Ligeti's choral works as they appeared in Kubrick's 2001.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Mother of Cosmos
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: The sounds of a resonant temple, perhaps existing inside the mouth of some great bestial mother, vibrating and reverberating in a hypnotic sway. A meditative raga, ululating the eternal "ra", in a waking sleep, in a dark stone chamber, in the compound eyes of a god.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Mother of Cosmos II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: The sounds of a resonant temple, perhaps existing inside the mouth of some great bestial mother, vibrating and reverberating in a hypnotic sway. A meditative raga, ululating the eternal "ra", in a waking sleep, in a dark stone chamber, in the compound eyes of a god.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: White Nothing
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: The invisible hand of God, strumming a celestial harp at the heart of a great storm, approaching from the frothing sea. Breamian recalls by a Bacchanalian philosopher in a study of overtones, reflections on the abyss and rhetorical communique with a mute, obscured creator in the entropic landscape he left for us to wander within.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Kinematic Initiatives
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: KINEMATIC INITIATIVES are sessions of generative modular & non-modular sound that consist solely of low-frequency oscillators (typically only used for modulation purposes in the sub-audible range) that move at rates quickly enough to bring them into the audible range. Within this framework, each LFO is independently tuned from the others, to form interesting harmonic layers presented as a massive, multi-voiced chord. This first volume of such recordings was located on one of three large-capacity thumb drives used for direct board recording on the Peavey FX2 mixing desk, without a date, but it is presumed to be from sometime in the chaotic Summer of 2020.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Roman Fountains
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: ROMAN FOUNTAINS is one of two (so far) pieces generated by way of selectively sampling Impressionist piano music, processing it with FFT (fast fourier transforms:  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_Fourier_transform  ) and then routing the resultant audio into the R-EW Audioholistics modular system. These experiments are always interesting, if for no other purpose besides learning new things about my existing generative systems and processors, things that may not have been quite so evident if I were not inputting music that was pre-recorded as opposed to being sporadically performed or created. ROMAN FOUNTAINS follows a similar methodology as WHITE NOTHING, but as you can plainly hear, the differences between the two are massive, as not only the original sampled music is different, but the instruments have changed as well, and yet both ROMAN FOUNTAINS and WHITE NOTHING manage to feel cohesive in some ways also, inhabiting domains of tonal music while almost completely avoiding recognizable melodic movements or other compositional conventions. Sonically, ROMAN FOUNTAINS brings to my mind what it may sound like if Brian Eno were to have written a score for a game in Cyan's Myst video game series, particularly Riven, which remains a big influence on much of my work. This is to say, it glides through passages of chordal unison that drift apart and back together again, while the voices of these movements themselves shift between textures that resemble bassoon, metal horns, FM synthesizers and even electric guitar. For being so constantly shifting and in-motion, ROMAN FOUNTAINS is a very placid listening environment that I hope you enjoy bathing in as much as I continue to.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume One], released July 20, 2022

Milieu.title: Divergent Paths [Volume Seven]
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
Divergent Paths collects ambient and generative recording sessions that were previously issued exclusively to subscribers of the Vibratelepathos series (  vibratelepathos.bandcamp.com  ) in box sets of eight sessions each. These sessions notably exist outside of the 'main' Vibra catalog, usually due to their origins as more unique or esoteric studio processes, sometimes involving the repurposing/reprocessing of outtakes or even damaged recordings that could not be otherwise released. The self-oscillating nature of the R-EW Audioholistics modular system makes many new things possible for audio that would otherwise be discarded, and Divergent Paths capitalizes fully upon this fact by providing a catalog dedicated solely to these peripheries.
Divergent Paths sessions are in no way considered to be lesser, or weirder, or more inaccessible than the Vibra series recordings - in truth, many of my favorite modular recordings to date reside within this series, such as 'Roman Fountains', 'Waterbearer' and 'Mesolith' to name a few (my favorite in this collection is 'Change Ringing'). It is for this reason I've decided now to offer these recordings to the general public, after they have enjoyed over two years in the shade of exclusivity, although their pricing here, in these eight-part collections, is more indicative of their runtimes and the box sets themselves.
All Divergent Paths sessions (noted by their PATHOS ## catalog designations) remain available to all new and existing subscribers of the Vibratelepathos series, at any subscription tier, and it is my sincere hope that this material is able to reach as many people as possible, whether it is a digital exclusive in a subscription service or a more formalized physical collection such as this, as the entirety of my Vibra session work is driven by a desire to facilitate healthy and pleasurable escapism through the medium of sound, as an aid to sleeping, meditation, creative work, substance-led and substance-free gnostic states and even more intimate applications.
Volume Seven of the Divergent Paths series collects the following eight sessions:
PATHOS 49 - A Divination at the Speechless Wall
PATHOS 50 - Rainfall on the Rusted Bell
PATHOS 51 - Forest Line
PATHOS 52 - Laves Tilings
PATHOS 53 - Drawing Hope From a Fountain of Evening Sun
PATHOS 54 - Declination
PATHOS 55 - Six Mapped Channels
PATHOS 56 - Change Ringing
Information about each individual session may be found in the track details section of each piece, for those interested. These notes include contextual details about where and when the pieces were recorded, patch notes and other relevant specifics.
Milieu.credits:
released July 15, 2025
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at White Pillar, 2024, using the R-EW Audioholistics generative system and modular processing path, in conjunction with several other external sound sources, machines and processors. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Milieu Music number PATH007. (C) + (P) Oscillog ASCAP 2025. All nights preserved.
Special thanks to the subscribers at Vibratelepathos, without whom these recordings might not exist at all, and to the members of the Milieu Music Fan Club at Patreon, whose continual support of my work is essential and gracious.

trackinfo.title: A Divination at the Speechless Wall
trackinfo.lyrics: "A Divination at the Speechless Wall" is the third experimental session to explore the singular three aspects of "A Topography of Will." It focuses on wavetable synthesizers, namely Synthesis Technology's E352 Cloud Terrarium and Waldorf's NW1, and reprocesses multiple iterations of these sounds through granular resampling and pitch shifting. Coaxing very formant/vocal overtones out of these machines is a constant fascination, and arguably a major reason for using them (especially the Waldorf machine, which makes prodigious use of text-to-speech synthesis), and here this particular facet of wavetable music is the primary color in the composition.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Rainfall on the Rusted Bell
trackinfo.lyrics: For the fiftieth subscriber-exclusive recording in the Vibratelepathos catalog, I am pleased to offer 'Rainfall on the Rusted Bell'—a transfiguration of 'The Time Bell in the Empty Archipelago' from the Sleepbuilding broadcasts. This session is procedurally generated by resampling the input of the original broadcast and reorganizing it with granular tools, panned delays, filters, pitch processors and fast Fourier transforms. It is an apt companion piece to 'Time Bell' in both a topical sense and a philosophical one—it places the composition into different contexts, with different considerations, and paints a solemn picture of entropic decline as the years pass by. I have long been fascinated with the notion that entropy applies to time itself, even though I've had many discussions with other thinkers about it and the general consensus is that entropy is simply what happens when time exists and modulates everything within it. It is an interesting thought, however, to think that even time as a process—or something alive in a way we cannot perceive it—must also have a beginning, middle and end, and will one day stop. Even the largest and slowest wave, riding with the tallest crest, will one day return to the shore.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Forest Line
trackinfo.lyrics: 'Forest Line' is a session of composted sound, harvested from the Sleepbuilding broadcast 'Focussed Light' and recontextualized into something even more minimalistic and warm. Using the same granular resampling system in Goldwave that has yielded many different variations within the Vibra releases, 'Forest Line' also explores a probabilistic resampler processing two stereo-swapped iterations of the audio, further reorganizing the music as sound-matter rather than something that follows compositional linearity. Two different Arturia low-pass filters were also employed to further color the sound, and finally the full summed mix was routed through a convolution reverb running an impulse response of the Inchindown oil tanks in Scotland - one of the longest reverberant spaces in the world. NOTE: 'Forest Line' has been mixed a little quieter than other recordings in this catalog. This is intentionally done for my own personal sleep-music usages, but as usual, how you prefer to listen to my music is up to you.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Laves Tilings
trackinfo.lyrics: 'Laves Tilings' was one of the few sessions recorded using the Virt Iter oscillator voice in Noise Engineering's Legio DSP platform, which allows for different operational modes to be easily flashed to the machine's firmware, completely changing the way it can be used. I'd played briefly with the Virt Iter voice when the Legio module arrived, because it came installed with that firmware, but I only did so much work with it since I mainly wanted the machine to be used as a stereo dynamics processor rather than a synthesizer voice (and if that sounds strange, that the same one machine can do both of those things, that is the entire point of what Noise Engineering are doing with their Legio and Versio platforms, making modular machines *themselves* operationally modular). In addition to this session being one of only a few with the Virt Iter Legio voice, it was also one of only a few that explored a user-designed firmware for the Versio - Repetita Versio, a looping multi-channel resampler - and this firmware was also swapped shortly after the 'Laves Tilings' session due to some instabilities in the machine's loop-point behaviors that made it difficult to rely on Repetita for long runtimes. 'Laves Tilings' is in the major pentatonic scale, and uses additional signal processing from Strymon's Starlab and Magneto, as well as a heavy amount of post-processing via Goldwave. More session work will inevitably be undertaken in the future, exploring Legio as a voice rather than a processor, but for now, 'Laves Tilings' stands alone as a bit of an orphan, and I hope you enjoy it despite this.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Drawing Hope From a Fountain of Evening Sun
trackinfo.lyrics: "Drawing Hope" was a single experimental session recorded using the 2HP Play sampler module, loaded with the granular waveforms migrated from FL Studio's library of onboard tools. It is in the major pentatonic scale, although it still manages to feel a little melancholic, as the sampler coaxes shimmering overtones out of angular oscillators, softened by low-pass filters from 2HP and Doepfer, as well as a seven-part panned delay system built with Strymon's four-head Magneto delay and Reticulum Versio's three-channel asynchronous delay, and finally stereo reverberation from Strymon's Starlab.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Declination
trackinfo.lyrics: "Declination" is a transfiguration of session material recorded for "A Balm of Conduction," using a granular resampling system, fast Fourier transforms, parametric equalization and a three-part delay chain to draw out longer sustained passages that resemble bowed string instruments rather than the woodwind tones of the original recordings. It approximates the stillness following a violent storm, a layer of lethargic sound cast across a rain-soaked landscape, slowly evaporating back into the clouds across two hours.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Six Mapped Channels
trackinfo.lyrics: "Six Mapped Channels" is a transfiguration of material generated during the mastering pass for "Enfleurage Septet," a long-form procedural modular composition that explored the Dorian scale within Behringer's recreation of the Solina String Synthesizer, a polyphonic analog machine originally designed and developed by ARP in the 1970s. This reinterpretation of that material emerged from re-sampling the Solina through Goldwave's Frequency Blend algorithm, then further shaping and processing it via Airwindows, Waldorf's D-Pole and various parametric equalizers. One of many "possible pasts."
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

trackinfo.title: Change Ringing
trackinfo.lyrics: "Change Ringing" is an early and informal session with Intellijel's Plonk module - a paraphonic Karplus-Strong synthesizer with instrument modeling by Applied Acoustics Systems. Despite its somewhat unserious name, Plonk is anything but what it implies with a very deep well of synthesis tools and programming options, and so it has taken more time and effort from me to learn it than many other modules have. With modular music and synthesis in general, there's never any big hurry for me to know all of my tools inside and out, and finding my way through them at my own pace is the interesting part. "Change Ringing" explores several bell tones playing through the Dorian mode, most of them at such a low octaval range that the overall pitch personality is not immediately apparent, instead offering the listener a dusky landscape of metallic surfaces that gently collide with one another, occasionally resonating out in the dimness. It reminds me of certain Eno compositions on "The Shutov Assembly" and "Neroli" as well as albums like "Tintinnabulation" from Irv Teibel in his Environments series, all of which cast a large and constant shadow over my work in this field.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Seven], released July 15, 2025

Milieu.title: Divergent Paths [Volume Six]
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
Divergent Paths collects ambient and generative recording sessions that were previously issued exclusively to subscribers of the Vibratelepathos series (  vibratelepathos.bandcamp.com  ) in box sets of eight sessions each. These sessions notably exist outside of the 'main' Vibra catalog, usually due to their origins as more unique or esoteric studio processes, sometimes involving the repurposing/reprocessing of outtakes or even damaged recordings that could not be otherwise released. The self-oscillating nature of the R-EW Audioholistics modular system makes many new things possible for audio that would otherwise be discarded, and Divergent Paths capitalizes fully upon this fact by providing a catalog dedicated solely to these peripheries.
Divergent Paths sessions are in no way considered to be lesser, or weirder, or more inaccessible than the Vibra series recordings - in truth, many of my favorite modular recordings to date reside within this series, such as 'Roman Fountains', 'Waterbearer' and 'Mesolith' to name a few (my favorite in this collection is 'On Being the Bearer and the Beholder'). It is for this reason I've decided now to offer these recordings to the general public, after they have enjoyed over two years in the shade of exclusivity, although their pricing here, in these eight-part collections, is more indicative of their runtimes and the box sets themselves.
All Divergent Paths sessions (noted by their PATHOS ## catalog designations) remain available to all new and existing subscribers of the Vibratelepathos series, at any subscription tier, and it is my sincere hope that this material is able to reach as many people as possible, whether it is a digital exclusive in a subscription service or a more formalized physical collection such as this, as the entirety of my Vibra session work is driven by a desire to facilitate healthy and pleasurable escapism through the medium of sound, as an aid to sleeping, meditation, creative work, substance-led and substance-free gnostic states and even more intimate applications.
Volume Six of the Divergent Paths series collects the following eight sessions:
PATHOS 41 - Wave Dream
PATHOS 42 - Opening a Mirrored Diamond
PATHOS 43 - A Weathered Memorial Stone in the Euphonic Meadow
PATHOS 44 - A Procession at the Pyramid of Geomancy
PATHOS 45 - The Snow and the Sleeping Hill
PATHOS 46 - Body Warming
PATHOS 47 - The Triadic Forest
PATHOS 48 - On Being the Bearer and the Beholder
Information about each individual session may be found in the track details section of each piece, for those interested. These notes include contextual details about where and when the pieces were recorded, patch notes and other relevant specifics
Milieu.credits:
released March 6, 2025
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at White Pillar, 2023-2024, using the R-EW Audioholistics generative system and modular processing path, in conjunction with several other external sound sources, machines and processors. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Milieu Music number PATH006. (C) + (P) Oscillog ASCAP 2025. All nights preserved.
Special thanks to the subscribers at Vibratelepathos, without whom these recordings might not exist at all, and to the members of the Milieu Music Fan Club at Patreon, whose continual support of my work is essential and gracious.

trackinfo.title: Wave Dream
trackinfo.lyrics: 'Wave Dream' is the result of routing unused compositional elements (drafted during the sessions for 'Ocean Lion IV' using vocal synthesis and noise generators) through a composter patch in the R-EW Audioholistics modular system. It bridges the spaces between the coastal stargazing 'Ocean Lion IV' and the seaside forest grove illustrated on 'Watch the Head' and 'The Severn Bore,' and conjures vivid imagery of a windswept beach at dusk, as the tide returns a strange glowing book to the shore, singing to us in our dreams, beckoning us to retrieve it. The recording is offered here as a subscriber exclusive, to provide that extra little bit of contextual backdrop for other more mainstream recordings, and to wave goodbye to the Summer.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: Opening a Mirrored Diamond
trackinfo.lyrics: 'Opening a Mirrored Diamond' is a new work composed by way of composting a different recording - in this case, 'April's Blissed Communion' from the ongoing Sleepbuilding broadcast catalog - and using a procedural path to transfigure and explore different forms, colors and temperatures. Built out of multiple passes of granular re-synthesis, 'Mirrored Diamond' is the inverse Autumnal sister of 'Blissed Communion' - a monument in its equivalent location in the Southern hemisphere, perhaps - and offers a different perspective on the material that feels distantly familiar, but never quite.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: A Weathered Memorial Stone in the Euphonic Meadow
trackinfo.lyrics: 'A Weathered Memorial Stone' is a three-hour composting of 'Quirinal Silver Boa' via the oft-used and now quite specifically developed Frequency Blend processor in Goldwave. It revisits the source material and transforms it into a cloud of pleasant vibration and warm blue air - another fruit of procedural generation, grown from a very small single-note monophonic sample as a seed. Thanks are due again to S.A. for his creative contribution and friendship.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: A Procession at the Pyramid of Geomancy
trackinfo.lyrics: A simple session recorded in mid-December 2023, using the Waldorf PPG Wave 3.V sequenced in the Dorian mode with Arturia's Keystep Pro, overlaid in three distinct pitch profiles via a Vesta Fire MR-10B mutlitrack tape machine. Subtle post processing was applied using a convolution reverb, Arturia's JUN-6 chorus, vactrol-like filters and parametric equalization. Much session work and patch development has been done with this Waldorf synthesizer throughout the last two years, but until now, very little of it has ended up in the Vibra catalog, a notable exclusion that led me here. I feel that this session complements the almost nonexistent snow flurries we've had thus far, with the PPG offering pointillistic fragments of melody, like the crystalline fragments of ice falling through the cold wind.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: The Snow and the Sleeping Hill
trackinfo.lyrics: 'The Snow and the Sleeping Hill' is a transfiguration of sound from the 'In Dark Waves' session from March of '23, which was a Dorian scale exploration of the waveshaping oscillator in Expert Sleepers' Disting Mk4 multipurpose module. Using a digital system consisting of granular resampling, fast Fourier transforms, pitch shifting and delay, the source sound is completely rearranged and produces this lush alternative perspective. Meant very much as a warm companion for reading and resting during the frigid Winter nights, I sincerely hope that 'The Snow and the Sleeping Hill' bring you some comfort as you keep out of the cold.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: Body Warming
trackinfo.lyrics: 'Body Warming' is a loop study, extracted from a more elaborate modular patch that explored the monophonic 2HP Play digital sampler, playing a held tone from Wildfire Laboratories' Yanqui non-controllable oscillator, and processing it through the veins of the rest of the R-EW system. It accompanies the unseasonably warm weather currently coloring the valley here, which feels prescient of Spring at a time when nothing has returned to bloom yet. Loop-focused composition remains a unique approach for me, with many different implications both aesthetically/topically, as well as philosophically. It continues to bear fruits such as this session, which I find are immediately comforting and useful, recalling the holistic utility I had in mind when I began the Vibratelepathos series in the first place.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: The Triadic Forest
trackinfo.lyrics: 'The Triadic Forest' is an example, one of many, of how the three sections of 'A Topography of Will' may be utilized to create new music. Here, two sections of different length have been extracted from the "Karplus Garden" and looped over one another for an hour. This audio was then sent to three different resampling systems, each with their own probability-based settings, to continuously resample and loop portions of the main loops, which are then filtered, modulated, delayed and panned in a configuration of hard left, hard right and stereo swapped. The resultant full mix is one that recalls 'A Topography of Will' in timbre and chordal profile, but is an entirely new piece of music.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: On Being the Bearer and the Beholder
trackinfo.lyrics: "On Being the Bearer and the Beholder" is a secondary study of only one aspect of the 83rd Vibra session - "A Topography of Will" - following the Leap Day release "The Triadic Forest." While the latter focused on incommensurable looping of different sections of the Karplus Garden third of Vibra 83, this release zeroes in on the Subtractive Garden - routing it through granular resampling systems and pitch processors that have been used prolifically in this series to create new branches in the path out of previous recordings. It considers one of many paradoxes in the creative act - the position of being both the expression of an idea and the recipient of that expression - which, through the proxy of a deliberately convoluted and imperceptibly detailed procedural working method, allows both perspectives to exist in the same moment. In thinking about this state, consciously, I am fascinated with the possibility of facilitating newer and more immediately relevant, or perhaps more honest (for lack of a better term), creative work, which can only exist when the bearer and the beholder are a singular entity in the same window of time.
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Six], released March 6, 2025

trackinfo.title: Pomonalia
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: POMONALIA is a unique session created with a generative patch in a digital modular software environment, which was then routed into the veins of the R-EW Audioholistics modular system, and subsequently shaped and conveyed according to two completely different sets of self-guided programming logics. It was recorded live on the evening of August 12th, 2021 in the Workshop.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Ornithic Limewash
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: ORNITHIC LIMEWASH is the result of a series of cascading accidents and unintended recording states in the White Pillar Workshop. Using room sound harvested from a session on the evening of August 5, 2021 in conjunction with a vocoder and the R-EW Audioholistics modular system, it was possible to reshape this otherwise "cutting room floor" material into something comfortable and relaxing. Additionally, this piece has been presented this way for the purpose of flexible home meditation and substance-assisted relief from pain, for two people going through a difficult time.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Rusted Onyx Compass
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
A third unexpected session constructing new shapes from two cassettes recorded in 2016-2017 (with assistance from John-Paul Kramer, designed for the purpose of subsequent live sound-collage performances) using a Tascam 414 multitrack tape machine, by playing them back at a much slower IPS (inches per second) speed on a Vesta Fire MR-10B multitrack tape machine, and routing them into the R-EW Audioholistics modular system.
One of the darkest Vibra sessions to date, RUSTED ONYX COMPASS offers a barren landscape without landmarks, blown empty by sour winds and purple radiation from a collapsing sun. Somewhere in the distance, the sound of metal being dragged across stone echoes, punctuated occasionally by higher pitched whines and bowed resonation, wafting up from some smoking ravine we're lucky to not be able to see. This piece was primarily designed as a companion to re-reading Wayne Douglas Barlowe's unique and fascinating novel about Hell, "God's Demon," and bears an optional disclaimer: RUSTED ONYX COMPASS may not be suitable for sleeping or meditation, and subscribers are encouraged to take this into consideration when listening.
This piece has also been mastered for lower level playback than the typical Vibra recording, and works best on headphones or playback within quieter physical spaces.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: A Distant Time
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: A DISTANT TIME was generated half-asleep while lying in bed, using two free Android apps on a Samsung cellphone (an FM synthesizer and a pitch processor). It was only minimally processed later on with a DAW for equalization and a small amount of supplemental reverberation. What the original impetus was for creating this music is now lost, and what remains is a beautiful almost 4-hour long piece of cozy blanket ambience. Even the title phrase was subconsciously claimed and hastily typed out in the final moments before sleep, making this a penultimate example of bedroom music in every sense of that term.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Mesolith
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
Sometimes, accidents happen in the studio, especially during feverish moments of overwhelming inspiration, which can compromise or otherwise ruin a recording, and in some such cases, the discovery that this has taken place does not happen until after a lengthy session. The remnants of the botched recording session are usually shelved indefinitely, and labeled as such, in the hopes that someday, something useful may yet be done with them. The Vibratelepathos series (and general working methodology) was developed with the use of any recording source bearing any level of quality in mind, so it has become possible to retrieve damaged and forsaken recordings and reprocess them into something new and viable. Previous recordings published after going through such a transfiguration include Ornithic Limewash and Amethyst Extracts, though each of these recordings utilized a completely unique approach in order to shape them into something listenable and cogent.
In the case of Mesolith, two extended sessions were recorded with incorrect microphone sources, resulting in a badly rendered room recording of the sessions rather than a direct-line input recording from the mixing desk. Through careful use of parametric equalization and various low/high/bandpass filters, it was possible to extract all relevant tonal information from these otherwise unlistenable recordings, isolate it and reprocess it into the unexpectedly beautiful renderings you hear now.
These types of transfigurative approaches are perfectly illustrative of the truly malleable properties of sound, considered as matter, and fully able to be renewed and revised at the molecular level by the R-EW Audioholistics modular system and processing path. Not only do their manifestations represent the successful meeting of incidental challenges that often crop up in studio work of any kind, but they also bring to mind the thought that in sound, it is possible to declare that no laws are ever fixed, that Mesolith and other sessions like it exist peripherally alongside any given recording that manifests in the studio, merely waiting for the right time and place to become observable. The thinking that any sound may be and may also become any other sound, at any point in the duration of that sound's runtime, and given the right tools and working order, that such pursuits are not only possible, but relatively simple and wholly obtainable.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

trackinfo.title: Kinematic Initiatives II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about:
KINEMATIC INITIATIVES are sessions of generative modular & non-modular sound that consist solely of low-frequency oscillators (typically only used for modulation purposes in the sub-audible range) that move at rates quickly enough to bring them into the audible range. Within this framework, each LFO is independently tuned from the others, to form interesting harmonic layers presented as a massive, multi-voiced chord. This second volume of such recordings was recorded on September 20, 2021, and offers a much more musical profile than the more drone-oriented first session.
All worlds, all times.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Waterbearer II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: Waterbearer II is the second session that revisits and reprocesses loops and soundcheck/test fragments from the Vision Chronograph sessions, transfiguring the detritus into something divine. A beautiful example of the versatility of the Audioholistics system, with both Waterbearer sessions remaining personal favorites of mine, offering a view of how disciplined sound synthesis can return gorgeous and musical results in addition to utilitarian listening tools. This second session has remained in stasis for quite some time, having been recorded as far back as December 2020, kept hidden away for many nights of respite and relief from the brutality of the world clawing at my walls. Springtime is a season of renewal, and so it feels apt to finally share it with the wider world. I hope you find as much comfort in these filtered soundwaves as much as I have.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Three], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Waterbearer
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: Recorded during the same sessions in December 2020 that produced Vision Chronograph, Waterbearer is a humming drone raga that came from a wishful mind, snowed under and locked inside, hopeful that the sound could melt away all of the dense snowfall. It was generated using the Roland SH-32 polyphonic digital synthesizer in tandem with the R-EW Audioholistics modular system, and was initially only a test session for a possible online broadcast. It appears here as a lush reprise of the more melodic and dynamic Vision Chronograph recordings, and should be considered supplemental to those.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Two], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Measured Air
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: Damned and forsaken upon the steps of the altar. Clouds twisting into knots overhead. A great wind ripples through stained vestments, signaling the departure of an elemental presence, a failed ritual, abandonment. The sky turns a deep burnt red, slowly, soundlessly, as another wind begins to blow in from no direction at all. One by one, the candles burning on the three incense-dusted pillars are extinguished, and the ancient stones begin to crumble.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Two], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Measured Air II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

trackinfo.title: Ornate Coral Reliquaries
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: ORNATE CORAL RELIQUARIES was the first of two sessions undertaken in May of 2021, using the R-EW Audioholistics modular system to explore and transfigure audio from a four-track cassette, initially recorded in 2016 for the purpose of live performance audio-collage work. The cassette contained processed sections of vinyl records, minimal electric guitar feedback, vocal experiments and sustained tones from a vintage Heathkit AO-1 oscillator. The tape was played back via a Vesta Fire MR-10B multitrack machine, which allowed selective isolation of any of the four audio channels previously recorded, and this output was routed directly into the R-EW system to produce what you hear.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Two], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Ruined Canyon Ossuary
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: RUINED CANYON OSSUARY was the second of two sessions undertaken in May of 2021, using the R-EW Audioholistics modular system to explore and transfigure audio from a four-track cassette, initially recorded in 2016 for the purpose of live performance audio-collage work. The cassette contained processed sections of vinyl records, minimal electric guitar feedback, vocal experiments and sustained tones from a vintage Heathkit AO-1 oscillator. The tape was played back via a Vesta Fire MR-10B multitrack machine, which allowed selective isolation of any of the four audio channels previously recorded, and this output was routed directly into the R-EW system to produce what you hear.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Two], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Sangean Sea
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital
trackinfo.about: SANGEAN SEA is another of the very early Vibra sessions that manifested in February of 2020. It utilizes a shortwave radio as the sound input source, which is then sent cascading through numerous modular processors and overlaid multiple times via a Vesta Fire MR-10B four-track tape machine. The resultant sound exists somewhere between an unnatural field recording, and naturalistic noise, offering a wide and deep horizon line of windswept waves and billowing clouds. In musical terms, not a lot happens, but SANGEAN SEA is a literal ocean of texture, filled to the brim with an ecosystem of unseen and unnamed wildlife, submarine plants and coral reefs, sunken vessels and perhaps even crevices so deep that these recordings cannot yet obtain readings that far down...and yet, above the surface of this rippling tidal world, the sun shines across little scribbles of land, perhaps islands or even continents filled with kingdoms and magics, dotting the distance.
trackinfo.credits: from Divergent Paths [Volume Two], released July 20, 2022

trackinfo.title: Sangean Sea II
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

Milieu.title: Dusk Maps
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
(This is SIDE A)
'Dusk Maps' is, at its core, a session of recordings from January of 2021, which was focused on loop studies using the Casio MT-210 "Pulse Code Modulation" synthesizer in conjunction with a Boss RC-20 looper, a Peavey PVDJ Grabber and FX2 mixer with custom DSP FX. This session was enjoyable and plans were made for it to be released, but kept slipping away as things like Vibratelepathos took precedence. In the time since, I've attempted to revisit the material in overdubbing capacities, always ending up somewhere so far removed from the loops themselves that the original session remained unused once again.
Finally, as Summer of '23 waned and gave way to a gorgeous quiet Autumn here in Ohio, I happened upon the perfect application/exploration of these recordings, using granular processors, fast Fourier transforms and other transformative means, allowing two distinct halves of a whole to emerge like flowers that have finally bloomed. They are warm, and sun-kissed, but not bathed in a Summer heat, and there is a subtle fluttering movement beneath their placid surfaces, which reminds me of the leaves trembling across the green grass as Autumn breezes through the valley.
So, 'Dusk Maps' arrives in two variations, which could be taken as volumes one and two, or sides A and B, but to my mind, they are more like 'NW Age' in how they both present a slightly different perspective on the same subject matter, reflecting each other at times, and augmenting each other at times. Topically speaking, these recordings would appeal to fans of 'cozy' minimal ambient albums such as 'Elide' and 'The Synthesist's Alphorn Retreat' while also recalling shades of my warm guitar stasis on SSR albums like 'The Loneliness of Empty Roads' or EPs from the 21MG Series, even though they are not guitar music, or organ music, while somehow timbrally resembling both in different moments.
However you approach these recordings, I hope they offer an easy and accessible listening experience that isn't really concerned with anything in particular - a pleasant sense of being still, inert and emptied. There is a lot of movement and overwhelming information in the world today, and my 'Dusk Maps' are something that may offer some shelter. Please be well, take care of yourselves, and remember to slow down and rest.
Milieu.credits:
released November 3, 2023
W/P by Brian Grainger. Initially recorded on January 23rd, 2021 using a Casio MT-210 in conjunction with a Boss RC-20, a PVDJ Grabber and a Peavey FX2 mixing desk. Subsequent reprocessing, arrangement and final mixing completed October-November 2023. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text by Brian. Design by ABM&D, using visual sampling of 'Aqueduct near Ephesus' by Luigi Mayer. Special thanks to Atoll Intercom Systems for font assistance. This is Milieu Music number MML185A. (C) + (P) Oscillog ASCAP 2023. All nights preserved.

Milieu.title: Echo Spectrum [Expanded & Remastered]
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about: Echo Spectrum and Boulevard Haze, both taken from the New Drugs album, were originally issued on this double-single set (backed by eight b-sides) in 2007, a few months ahead of the album. As such, this release is a sort of sister to New Drugs, containing several tracks that didn't make the cut but remain fan favorites today (see: Pinwheel Carousels, Bicycle Day). It is only appropriate then, that Echo Spectrum finally gets the same expanded reissue and remaster treatment as New Drugs, which is what I'm happy to present you with here. Accompanying the original ten tracks are eight others from various locations: Albatrosses / Counting Lights from Calico Fountain Melange, Solar Window / Night Flight / Lab Version of Plume Train from Muted Travels and Hi Teens from Bent Appletrees 2 - a track I always regretted not including on a proper album somewhere. Closing the set is the previously unreleased vignette piece, Charlotte Space, which was originally recorded for Muted Travels but had to be left off for time constraints. There is also a small artifact from Germany included here, for your chuckling pleasure.

Milieu.title: Echogee Afternoon
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
Originating during the frenzied months of session work for 2023's "Watch the Head" album, the piece of procedurally arranged ambient music that would become the end of that album arrived in a longer duration than the closing slot could afford. A modest 5-minute edit was made for that purpose, and the full arrangement of "Echogee" was set aside with an eventual separate release later on. 2024 came and went, and with both the 20th anniversary celebrations for Milieu (which included the expansive triple-disc "Butcher Block Andromeda II" retrospective and the 200+ page "Knows No Bounds" paperback book) and the continuous session work for Coppice Halifax's "Mountain Interval," the planned expansion of "Echogee" didn't fully materialize until now, in the cold and wet Spring season of a pretty miserable 2025 year.
As many people who know me would tell you, I am often discussing how little I am interested in rushing or pushing things along with unnatural schedules in my creative work. Things happen only if and when they are meant to happen, and so "Echogee" has arrived at a moment that I didn't think it would, but it feels more considered and practical now, to have something so pretty and introspective be released during a truly nightmarish moment in American history. Ornate and comforting modes of escapism are not just useful during times of great stress and strain, but essential, and so it feels good to have something like "Echogee" in my archives just waiting to become a beam of warm sunlight in a dim and cold era.
There is not much else to write or say about "Echogee," that the sound of the recordings cannot more efficiently convey. It is ambient music as I have made in the past, nothing entirely new or groundbreaking, but not so much a genre exercise as it was/is an attempt to revisit a very "classical" ambient compositional framework, as the inimitable Eno laid out decades ago. "Echogee" consists of several different synthesizer voices, each held to a minimum of contributions - sometimes two chords or a two-or-three note melodic motif, but usually just one note - and these parts are all allowed to come and go in their own time, independent of each other, but compositionally arranged to be mindful of overlapping with one another in any combination. This sort of procedural music making has never failed to interest and fascinate me, and learning to write music like this has led me toward so many other tools and approaches, from tape assemblages and live looping improvisations with guitar and organ, to modular music and all manner of unorthodox methods of sequencing and modulating.
And yet, despite all of these varied systems and methods of working, my music has not entirely changed, and this is probably a positive thing, since you are most likely reading this passage as someone who has been here with me before, perhaps returning in the hopes of finding another warm wooden hollow, another blue rainbow arcing over this green valley. "Echogee" proves that despite the path winding through different seasons and landscapes, we always manage to find each other again, never quite remembering or forgetting how it happened before. I'm happy to still be here with you, trying to find a way, and I hope you'll relax a while, and just listen to the wind blowing through the leaves with me.

Milieu.title: Elide
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about: Elide is a somewhat unexpected ambient Milieu album, which resides somewhere between the recent Ambell Suns release (which transfigured melodies from Bell'n Dither into sad ambient microforests) and the upcoming Statuettes Part Two album, recorded years ago and scheduled for a release at ROHS in Berlin. It collects a series of isolated shorter sessions, undertaken throughout the Autumn and Winter seasons of 2017/2018, which use sampled bells, thumb pianos and various tonal percussion elements alongside analog synthesizers and outboard processors. All of this is gently hushed along like leaves in a valley breeze, through soft field recordings and manipulated radio static. Music for dreaming about Summer in the colder parts of the year, inspired by things such as GAS, Purl, Arjen Schat and the usual suspects such as SAW II, Variant, Irv Teibel's Environments and Wendy Carlos' Sonic Seasonings.
Milieu.credits:

Milieu.title: Enfleurage Septet
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
"Aye! I am a poet and upon my tomb
Shall maidens scatter rose leaves
And men myrtles, ere the night
Slays day with her dark sword.
'Lo ! this thing is not mine
Nor thine to hinder,
For the custom is full old,
And here in Nineveh have I beheld
Many a singer pass and take his place
In those dim halls where no man troubleth
His sleep or song.
And many a one hath sung his songs
More craftily, more subtle-souled than I;
And many a one now doth surpass
My wave-worn beauty with his wind of flowers,
Yet am I poet, and upon my tomb
Shall all men scatter rose leaves
Ere the night slay light
With her blue sword.
‘It is not, Raana, that my song rings highest
Or more sweet in tone than any, but that I
Am here a Poet, that doth drink of life
As lesser men drink wine.'"
-Ezra Pound, 'And Thus in Nineveh' (1908)
---
"Enfleurage Septet" is the 27th Sleepbuilding broadcast to be published for free online. It was originally streamed live on August 18th, 2023, and it is my very first session with Behringer's remake of ARP's Solina String Ensemble synthesizer. Sequencing was done in the Dorian scale (this changed to the major pentatonic scale for Part 5) with Arturia's Keystep Pro, and additional signal processing was facilitated by the R-EW Audioholistics modular system.
2024, as a year, has felt like yet another ocean of extremes - in everything from weather to politics - and within that kind of an atmosphere, I've needed to run for shelter more often than not. It has become essentially important for me to make the time to step outside when there is a sunny day, to turn off the faucet of constant negative information that the internet provides, in order to remind myself - multiple times a day, on particularly hard days - that I am lucky to be far away from those things. Perhaps not very far away, but far enough away that I have a grassy yard that is warmed by a golden sun in a picturesque blue sky, and I can sit there and marvel at that distance.
Distance that is necessary, for my own mental and physical well-being. "Enfleurage Septet" is this and only this - a form of distance between myself and the so-called real world, something to keep the clouds at arm's length while I focus on my work, my family, my friends. There isn't anything particularly profound or novel about it - it resembles in many ways a number of prior Sleepbuilding recordings - but I've come to appreciate things that are comfortable in their predictability, and I hope that you can appreciate these things in any way at all that is similar to how I see them. Thank you for being here, for listening, for being yourself.
---
YouTube playlist of all Sleepbuilding broadcasts:  www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbcjgVJRSgeSHy00DZLB8zFFIJbIgcYjo
All prior Sleepbuilding releases to date (all FREE): campsite.bio/oscillog
For more generative ambient music delivered to your inbox automatically each month, please consider subscribing to my Vibratelepathos series:  vibratelepathos.bandcamp.com
24/7 Endless Ambient Broadcast Station at Twitch:  twitch.tv/analogbotany

Milieu.title: Enjoy Your Stay At The Holograph Lounge [10th Anniversary Remaster]
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
FROM THE AUTHOR, SUMMER 2021:
Fifteen varied, colorful and sometimes off-kilter tracks from the H IS FOR HOLOGRAM sessions, arguably sharing their concepts of space with Pink Space, and offering a lighter listening experience to accompany the main affair. Desserts and a digestif, following a cosmically exhausting jaunt across the galaxy.
Originally outtakes from H IS FOR HOLOGRAM, the tracks on ENJOY YOUR STAY have been lovingly remastered from their point of origin, covered in digital dust, now cleaned up with the tools of the future to provide a more robust and detailed playthrough. Here, ten years later, ENJOY YOUR STAY also receives a renewed design by Atoll Intercom Systems, matching the accompanying HOLOGRAM/SLEEP reinstatements, with some fresh new fantasist copy included on the CD edition as well.
Seasoned Milieu fans as well as science-fiction geeks will recognize many of the references made here to books, television shows, video games and films, although the music itself should offer enough diversion with or without these topical connections. ENJOY YOUR STAY contains a wealth of bedroom electronics and space-age grooves, seemingly conjured via a starship radio operator, fumbling the dial through the bands in search of a station to refuel at.
ORIGINAL COPY, 2011:
So 2011 is ending, and you're sitting in your DeLorean thinking "What about the future?"...just then, a blinding flash of light slightly stuns you as Ace Rimmer appears in a sparkly clean space-suit with Berlin playing in the background. He hands you a small square disk not unlike the outmoded floppies PCs used in the 80's and 90's. This one has "Get your ass to Mars" scribbled on it with a smiley face giving a thumbs up. Before you can ask what it's for, Ace is gone, leaving only the faintest space-dust trail behind his rocket. You pull out your communicator to call Doc Brown, he'd probably know what to do with this disk. Upon arriving at Doc's lab, he knowingly inserts the disk into his Pip-Boy 7000 and decodes the data, which is revealed to be a 15-part message detailing the location of a swank holographic lounge, somewhere on the other side of the galaxy. After about a week of calculating Pi with Doc's fancy AI (conveniently named Holly) you know enough to build a transporter device to get you to the party just in time. A second blinding flash of light, and the feeling of being poured out of a bottle and into one of those tie-die machines...and suddenly you're naked and confused in the back of a smoky nightclub. You're approached by a silvery droid that asks "Nice night for a walk?" to which you reply "Your clothes - give them to me, now" and the robot kindly produces a red Starfleet uniform. Knowing what this means, you fear for your life until you open the door to the dancefloor and hear "Last Night Ace Rimmer Saved My Life" and realize all is as it should be. You make your way to the glowing neon bar and order a Pan-Galactic Gargle Blaster from the Asari Matriarch behind the counter. After a few sips, your vision blurs, blurs some more and before you know it you're cosmic surfing past Jupiter and well beyond the infinite. After the effect wears off you realize you just passed out on the Holodeck with a Ligeti record stuck in a locked groove. You tiredly walk over to the kiosk, take the LP off the turntable and curl up in the lovely soft bed sitting conveniently nearby. A tall dark monolith appears at the foot of the bed to say goodnight and turn the lights down. What a day. Next time you're totally going to Westworld instead.

Milieu.title: Ever Constant, Ever Branching
Milieu.label: Milieu Music Digital
Milieu.about:
What is repetition? What is divergent? How can you tell?
As time passes, my perspective changes, as does the landscape before me, everything in constant motion, together and apart. This duality that seems so obvious, and yet confounds me continually, surrounds and contains all things. I am a part of this arrangement, and everything I could ever say or do is too.
So here is something else, perhaps comforting and perhaps not. A composition that is both repetitious and completely serialized. A set of soundwaves that animate and yet do not proceed to anywhere beyond where they already are. Designed meticulously across two days of patching expressly for Milieu's twentieth anniversary party's afterparty, to both draw a line in the sand and relax beside it.
What you hear that resembles bassoon, oboe or clarinet perhaps is actually two different wavetables within Synthesis Technology's E352 Cloud Terrarium, themselves sourced from different synthesizers of the past. These wavetables have been doubly filtered via a Buchla Quad Lo-Pass Gate and low-pass filters from Doepfer and 2HP, before being routed through an extensive FX array, which includes two instances of Mutable Instruments' Clouds alongside Strymon's Magneto four-head tape delay and Starlab reverberator. The voices are playing a simple major pentatonic scale, albeit one continuously varied by Euclidean trigger sequences and a Turing machine that determines the octaval range and sustain of each note in the scale.
Everything in motion, everything remaining in a sustained state of continuous flux. Are you, the listener, the constant in the equation? Or have you already changed as well? On and on, the soundwaves peal outward across the surrealistic landscape of red yellow blue and green, and almost everything else between, and there may never be an answer.
Milieu.credits:
released September 6, 2024
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded and broadcast live from White Pillar on the evening of August 30 through the early morning hours of August 31, 2024, following the 20th anniversary livestream and release party for Butcher Block Andromeda Vol. II, All sounds generated in realtime by the R-EW Audioholistics modular system. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text by Brian. Design by ABM&D, using illos from Greg Lawhun, paintings by Frantisek Kupka and a displacement map. This is Milieu Music number MMD125. (C) + (P) Oscillog ASCAP 2024. All nights preserved.
